result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos M. Infante-Cortes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlos M. Infante-Cortes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carlos M. Infante-Cortes was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos M. Infante-Cortes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos M. Infante-Cortes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to remove the repeater, 961.41(3g)(e).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. to be be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 amended to remove the repeater, now making it a Misd. Possession THC 961.41(3g)(e).

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1. Count 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that there also is a traffic matter, 16TR2050 and asks the court to dismiss based upon the plea.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before April 3, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Wood County
Credit = 5 days
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
16TR2050 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Carlos M. Infante-Cortes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR2050 tracking:
Atty Gumz requests that the matter be reset due to the defendant needing to set up jail transfer.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Carlos M. Infante-Cortes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR2050 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant waived time limits for the Prelim.  Atty Gumz states that in speaking with the State and his client; the defendant would be waiving the Preliminary Hearing and asks for a plea to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea.
bond continued

*Did not do waiver of prelim*  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Carlos M. Infante-Cortes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing for date 10-10-16
Notice of Hearing for 10-10-2016
Initial appearance on October 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Posted - GovPayNet by phone

Initial appearance on September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
*No special conditions

Att Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that he is uncertain if the defendant does qualify for PD appointment and asks for an Initial Appearance to be set at a later date.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.

BY THE COURT: Reset Initial Appearance.

Defendant Carlos M. Infante-Cortes in court, in custody.  Atty Mark Gumz appears by telephone as special appearance today only.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions Atty Gumz.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does understand the English language.  Court confirms the defendant's address.


Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz makes bond arguments and asks for a $200 cash bond to be set.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:  Initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
